comment.text: This translation key is used for a UI element that displays the text "Opening a document" as part of a deep link functionality. It appears on a file tile in a document editor interface and helps users understand the purpose of the deep link.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "Sənədin açılması" is a literal translation of "Opening a document", it sounds unnatural in Azerbaijani. A more natural phrasing would be "Sənəd açılır" or "Sənədini açmaq".

The translation "Dokument wird geöffnet" is a present tense, passive voice construction, literally meaning "Document is being opened." A more natural and accurate translation of "Opening a document" (which implies the action of opening) would be something like "Dokument öffnen" or "Ein Dokument öffnen".

The English phrase 'Opening a document' is best translated as something more specific to the context of a deep link. 'Avataan asiakirjaa' is a literal translation implying an active process of opening. A more contextually accurate translation would depend on the intended action - e.g., 'Avaa asiakirja' (Open document) or 'Asiakirjan avaaminen' (Document opening).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'Avaa asiakirja' or 'Asiakirjan avaaminen' depending on the intended action.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "ドキュメントを開いています" literally translates to "Opening a document" or "Document is being opened." While technically correct, it's more passive than the English phrase "Opening a document." A more natural and active phrasing would be better suited for a DeepLink key.

The translation '문서 여는 중' (munseo yeoneun jung) is a literal translation of 'Opening a document' but sounds awkward and unnatural in Korean. It implies the action is currently in progress. A more natural and accurate translation would be something like '문서 열기' (munseo yeolgi) - 'Document opening' or '문서 보기' (munseo bogi) - 'View document'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 문서 열기 (munseo yeolgi) or 문서 보기 (munseo bogi)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "ກຳລັງເປີດເອກະສານ" is a literal translation of "Opening a document," it implies an action in progress. A more accurate and natural translation for a key name (which often represents a state) might be "ເອກະສານເປີດ" (Document Open) or "ເອກະສານໄຂ" (Document Opened).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ເອກະສານເປີດ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Latvian translation 'Notiek dokumenta atvēršana' translates literally to 'A document is being opened'. While not entirely incorrect, it's a more verbose and less natural way to express 'Opening a document'. A more direct and natural translation would be 'Dokumenta atvērums' or 'Atver dokumentu'.

The translation "A abrir um documento" while literally meaning "Opening a document," is not the idiomatic or standard way to express this in Portuguese. It sounds unfinished or like an action in progress, but not a completed or intended action.

The translation "ලේඛනයක් විවෘත කිරීම" is a literal translation of "Opening a document". While grammatically correct, a more natural and idiomatic Sinhala translation might be preferred depending on the context.  'විවෘත කිරීම' sounds somewhat formal. A more common phrasing might include 'තියවන්න' (thiyavanna - to open/view) or 'පෙන්වන්න' (penvanna - to show/display).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like "ලේඛනය ತೆරවන්න" (lekkhayanā tharavannā) or "ලේඛනය පෙන්වන්න" (lekkhayanā penvanna)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Turkish translation 'Belge açılıyor' translates more accurately to 'Document is opening' rather than 'Opening a document'. While not strictly wrong, it doesn't capture the passive voice of the original English phrase as well.
